column4: Hi. Suppose I've installed a STS version of Ubuntu and did some things (for example, installed LyX and changed wallpaper). Then on some date I found that a newer LTS version of Ubuntu is available. Would an update require me to re-install LyX and to change wallpaper again? Or just a reboot, and everything fine?
Updates shouldent be affecting the users settings
Updates shouldent be affecting the users settings - Where is it mentioned in documentation at ubuntu.com?
i dont recall ever seeing a apt package ive instgalled that ever messed with the users /home/user/WHATEVER files.
thats part of how the apt system works.
when doing updates/upgrades ive often (in the past) had to reset users settings due to changes in the new packages.
there shouldent be any negative issues
in theory,
i perfer 'weechat' to irssi for text based irc clients.
sudo apt-get install Skype
IDK what repository but this line should work
i just right click on the link and select open
ok! great. but shouldn't it open when I *just* click on it?
see what oCean_  said.
those just confuse users..
deends on where its hanging at.

any idea on what to do?
